hints.content:
We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value. 

Which digit is the largest?

$\maroonD8$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD8$ will be in the ten thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{8}$ $\_{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD7$.  

  So  $\blueD7$ goes in the thousands place:  

$\maroonD{8}$$\blueD7{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

We can continue placing the next largest digit  in the next largest place value until we have placed all five digits:

$\maroonD{8}$$\blueD7{,}$$431$
The greatest possible number we can make is $87{,}431$.

question.content:
**Arrange the digits $8, 1, 4, 3,$ and $7$  to create the greatest possible five-digit number.**

[[â˜ƒ sorter 1]]
